answers.answer: Hi MyID.  You have a significant medical history, one  being the hep c diagnosed only three years ago with current pain in your mediastinum (rib cage area -- probably your liver hurting due to disease.)  Passing out and hitting the ground?  Was this due to your ammonia levels being high?  You have classic signs of complications from liver disease from the Hep .  Are you being followed by a liver doctor?  Are you being followed at ALL for your hep?You were jaundiced a few years back (very significant -- not good news).  Do you drink alcohol?  If so, you have to put it down or it will kill you.Have you ever been on any treatment for the hep c?  Geno 3 a would mean ... 24 weeks, or - did they try any treatment.  Have you ever had a liver biopsy ?I am so sorry your husband passed away.You have some very serious things going on, all of which I highly suspect are all Hep C related.I have Hep C.  Geno 1a.  Have been carrying it since the mid 70's; found out three years ago after being worked up for depression, anxiety, and a number of other strange ailments.There is a very good forum under the gastroenterology section here for Hep C - very good.Raynauds disease in your Your sister - are you talking about the blood circulation disorder?Diabetes can be a biggie with Hep C - Hep C create diabetes  (cause it).  What kind of doctor are you seeing?  You are seriously sick.The pain in that area if your liver - this is not a good sign.You need to be seen by a doctor immediately (not a family doctor, either -- a specialist).   WIth what you are saying now, I would recommend you go to the ER -- have someone take you or call 911.

question: I am a 41yr old female. Partical hysterectomy 15 years prior. No hormonal therapy. Husband passed away 2002/dr put me on xanax. 1mg one time a day, been on that since 2002. Genotype 3A hepatits/Diagnosed in February 2004 after turning jaundice in oct of 2003 but didnt show positive result till feb 2004.Head injury 2 years ago, passed out hit head on ground 8 staple to head/from then on acid reflux, choke on food/fluids/body trembles and cant speak correctly after an occurance happens/words slurred feel intoxicated.Heart will race during occurance,body flenching around, slurred speech. family history:heart disease/father, both sister & father:hypoglycemic, sister/rhinods disease/youth history of seizures/but not anymore. To my knowlege except for hep c, i have no prior health issues but do have stress problems/depression. Diagnosed w/Eptsein barr syndrome. I also am experiencing under the bone that u look for b4 applying cpr? under that little bone i have ALOT of pressure and pain that radiates around a fist size in dimension of where the pain STAYS. HELP ME,Please.
title: Losing ability to speak correctly after this happens
